channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar discusses killing of Minnesota lawmaker Melissa Hortman
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks with Sen. Amy Klobuchar, D-Minn., about the killing of Minnesota lawmaker Melissa Hortman, who was fatally shot a day after they had dinner together.

item.title: Suspect in killing of Minnesota lawmaker and husband taken into custody and charged
item.description: The man suspected of killing a Minnesota lawmaker and her husband and wounding another lawmaker and his wife on Saturday was taken into custody and charged, state officials said.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Suspect in killing of Minnesota lawmaker and her husband taken into custody and charged, the latest on the escalating conflict between Iran and Israel, President Trump arrives in Canada for G7 summit.

item.title: Rescue teams search for missing people in West Virginia following deadly flash floods
item.description: Rescue teams are searching for people reported missing in West Virginia after torrential rain caused flash flooding on Saturday night that killed at least five others.

item.title: Israel's conflict with Iran takes focus even as Gaza war grinds on
item.description: Israel's conflict with Iran is pushing its war in Gaza to the periphery. But Palestinians there are still being killed and are under a near-total blockade.

item.title: Can this Myanmar student still realize U.S. college dreams under a Trump travel ban?
item.description: NPR speaks with a student from Myanmar who fears his plans to attend graduate school in the U.S. could be derailed by the administration's newest travel ban.

item.title: President Trump wants the U.S. to have a role in commercial shipbuilding
item.description: The U.S. is no longer a player in the world of commercial shipbuilding. President Trump wants to change that.

item.title: The latest on the escalating conflict between Iran and Israel
item.description: Missile strikes between Iran and Israel continued over the weekend. NPR reports the latest on the rapidly intensifying conflict.

item.title: Foreign affairs analyst and author Robin Wright discusses the Iran-Israel conflict
item.description: NPR speaks with Robin Wright, a foreign affairs analyst and author who has written about Iran for decades for publications including "The New Yorker." She's author of several books on the country.

item.title: Organizers say weekend protests drew in millions as Trump hosted military parade
item.description: Organizers say weekend protests against President Trump and his policies drew millions of people nationwide. The demonstrations were held as Trump hosted a military parade in Washington, D.C.
